data.title: Global Conquest with external app
data.body:
i have post that idea before but i came with an easyer way for the devs to add it
what if we have an external "server program" (and a client program) that will act as a loby(with a global map with regions and attack options),then when the players start an (visual) invasion in the loby it will automaticly start a dedicated server placing the players in some predifinend positions (an spawn actor named lets say "globspwan" for example)
if one side wins then the server will sent the data to the "server program" and change the color of the area\region\country to the wining side to blue or red allied\soviets and change the owner side name of the region
after that the "server program" will sent the data to the client program with the changes(so the players plan ther next attack)

extra info on the idea
the idea is that the "server program" will sent a command to the client program and force it to start the openra and force join the dedicated server and force the player to set team,side,and ready status.

the dedicated server must be some how hiden from the normal server list.

well what you think about it?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5100810-global-conquest-with-external-app?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Make the RA/D2K/TS map chooser layout consistent with the lobby.
Fixed Tiberian Sun harvester under attack notification not playing
data.body: This fixes #6671 and documents things better for the future.

data.title: Gave medic and mechanic lower selection priorities
data.body: It is currently quite hard to micro manage them in huge infantry crowds. They won't stay behind your front-line on their own and I usually waste them when attack moving everything towards the enemy. Now they will stay behind, which is a good default in those cases.

data.title: Move sprite parsers into mod code
data.body:
This unhardcodes our sprite parsers and moves them into the mod assemblies.  Mods now specify the formats that they use and the order in which files should be tested.

New sprite formats (such as gif) will now be much simpler to implement.  This also fixes the format-detection clash between R8 and TmpTS, which was blocking further progress on the TS tileset converter and ingame map editor.

data.title: Revert "build with latest Mono from @Xamarin"
data.body: Mono 3.10 appears to ship a broken compiler that chokes on ternary statements.  This is causing our travis tests to fail.

data.title: "HarvesterAttackNotification" is not triggered when Harvesters are under attack
data.body:
i found this in TS:

I build 3 Harvesters and ordered them to an enemy Base where they gets attacked 4 solders shoots at them but no notification worse triggered: The Sound files are correct and event is listed in notifications.yaml but it isnt triggered

data.title: Fix TS offsets for good
data.body:
I had suspected that the offsets were still wrong, but didn't have time to look at them properly until now.

Turns out they were a mess. I used TS' own blank01 tile as test grid and whipped the offsets into shape.
Additionally, I set okayish selection bounds for structures as temporary solution until we have proper isometric selection boxes.
Finally, the fixed offsets allowed to fix the factory exits as well.

data.title: Rush the replay page at OpenRA Resource Center
data.body: By God I miss the old replay resource site. I know our beloved developers are doing their best to get the new replay page up at OpenRA Resource Center http://resource.openra.net/replays up and running ASAP but I'd rather see this finished sooner rather than later. Posting and downloading replays is just so damn FUN and I'm sure, a great asset to a thriving player base. Here's a small incentive for it's completion (bounty).

data.title: Mods.Common effects
data.body:
Moves more effects over to Mods.Common.

Depends on #6663, will need to rebased when that is pulled

data.body: Fixes #6665.

data.title: Demolish as Enter subclass
data.body: Makes Demolish a subclass of Enter.

data.title: Moved more stuff to Mods.Common
data.body:
Picked some more low-hanging fruits.

This time: 
- ResourceClaim and related changes
- Smoke effect and SmudgeLayer + related changes
- PlayMusicOnMapLoad

data.title: Enter subclasses & fix for 6658
data.body: Makes CaptureActor a subclass of Enter and fixes #6658.

data.title: Add a trait that gives out ammo/health to units in the vicinity.
data.body:
A trait that has a radius or a deploy target for other units, so they can get health recovered or limited ammo supplies replenished.

Optionally, include an effect where it uses pips and counts each pip as a "supply" that gives health or ammo, and needs to be restocked at the service depot.
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Turret facing fix
data.body: Fixes #6655.

data.title: Turret realignment for combat tanks in d2k doesn't work properly
data.body:
> Ordos and Harkonnen combat tank seem to be broken, but the Atreides one works. This may be a problem on the YAML side.`

---

> This is caused because IFacing is being queried in the constructor from before it has been initialized for those actors. Wrapping that query in a Lazy or using INotifyCreated fixes the issue.`

data.title: RallyPoints should gets included while testing "is building Placeable"
data.body:
When we Build a Barracks (in TS) and place a Refinery in front of it with no place between the Buildings, the Production can not be Finished. :( 

"Eva says: Unable to Comply buiding progress" and Infantriys cant leave the Barracks (Infantry is marked as "Ready"
We should also check when we place a building that the rallypoint is not on this location :/ also we should include "minimal Adjancemend" on factorys :/

data.title: Disable movement of EMPd actors
data.body: This implements the a missing piece from #6528 and uses `IDisableMove` to improve the EMP effect.

data.title: Fix crash when husks are spawned by a moving actor.
data.body: Fixes #6648.

data.title: TD weapons factory overlaps units in front of it
data.body:
![screen shot 2014-10-04 at 12 19 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/4513795/e80cff40-4b53-11e4-9158-f1a77cab6c59.png)

The best fix would be to replace `RenderBuildingWarFactory` → `WithProducedOverlay` (or maybe expand `WithProductionOverlay` to define different sequences for producing vs produced), and then set a Z-offset of around 256, which should be enough to cover exiting units but not those in front.

data.title: Allow Lua bridge to convert between LuaTable and arrays.
data.body: This removes some of the pain from writing new API methods, and gives more specific type information in the generated docs.

data.title: Balancing: Reduced Commando HP
data.body:
The general consensus from the online players of the CNC mod is that the Commandos have too much HP. The case is often a few Commandos are dropped in the base, gain instant experience level up by using a C4 on valuable structures and then becomes an unstoppable wave of destruction. Most of the time not even a direct hit from airstrike will kill one at base stats and now with flame tanks being nerfed they're more of a juggernaut than ever. More people are getting frustrated by the "[expletive deleted] Commandos" every day and even those who frequently use this unit agree that they're somewhat OP.

So easy change: 150HP is adequate. With the reduction, commandos can still take on a guard tower, they still get their instant-level up on destroying structures and surprise invasive attacks are an effective part of GDI's strategy; but this change should stop a 1000$ unit crawling through armies of tanks and soldiers to plant three more C4s than should be reasonable. For as things stand now, Commandos are more deadly than A-Bombs, and you can build as many as your income allows.
